answers.answer: I don't know but if it was me I would be making an apt with my Dr. to hopefully get some answers.
My first thoughts are diabetes or thyroid issues.  You should see your doctor and have some labs done.

Hello!It is important to understand the period of your layoff.If it is just for a couple of weeks then you have to follow up with a physician to get your hemoglobin levels checked and other basic indicators monitored such as blood pressure and heart rate.Eat a balanced diet and increase your protein intake.If your symptoms continue then go for some blood tests to rule out diabetes and thyroid dysfunctions.Give yourself some time and also rule out menstrual problems etc. If it was a long lay off then it is due to stiffness and low endurance.Take care!

question: I am 39 year old female.  I rarely get sick.  I never go to the doctor unless I've injured myself.  I do not take any medications beyond the occassional Tylenol.  I work out regularly and I bike commute.Recently, I had to take a few weeks off from the gym and riding my bike because I just felt BAD.  I was having occassional chest pain, was extremely tired, and just felt bad.  Since then, I have noticed that I am constantly thirsty and have extremely dry skin and hair, and I don't know why.  I never drink anything less than 80oz of water a day.  During the summer months it's more like 160 oz of water a day, so it's not that I'm not drinking enough water..I am back to riding my bike everyday, and I am trying to get going in the gym again.  I'm noticing a lack of strength that is simply not explained by the few weeks I took off.What the heck is wrong with me?
title: What The Heck Is Wrong With Me?
